articles.description: The rain-ruined draw in the fourth Ashes Test was an anti-climax, but England must rouse themselves for the finale at The Oval, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: 'How are we supposed to feel about this?'

articles.description: Brian Harman overcomes an early wobble to stroll serenely to his first major title with a six-shot victory at the 151st Open Championship in Hoylake.
articles.title: Harman strolls to Open title at Royal Liverpool

articles.description: Max Verstappen described his Hungarian Grand Prix victory as "a pretty perfect day" - and Red Bull could be set for a perfect season, says Andrew Benson.
articles.title: 'Red Bull rocket machine has potential to sweep the board'

articles.description: What to expect from day five of the Fifa Women's World Cup, with Italy facing Argentina, Germany playing Morocco and Brazil meeting Panama.
articles.title: Benzina set to make history on World Cup day five

articles.description: Zharnel Hughes breaks the British record for the men's 200m with a time of 19.73s at the London Diamond League.
articles.title: Hughes breaks 30-year British 200m record

articles.description: Denmark's Jonas Vingegaard seals his second successive Tour de France triumph as Jordi Meeus sprints to a surprise win on the final stage.
articles.title: Meeus wins stage as Vingegaard retains Tour title

articles.description: Some of Europe's leading clubs believe there is a possibility Tottenham will sell striker Harry Kane this summer.
articles.title: Top European clubs holding out for Tottenham's Kane

articles.description: Zharnel Hughes reveals he again predicted his British record run after clocking 19.73 seconds in the 200m at the London Diamond League.
articles.title: Hughes once again predicts British record time

articles.description: Watch Brian Harman's final round at Royal Liverpool as he wins his first major title with a six-shot victory at the 151st Open Championship.
articles.title: 'Brilliant' - Watch Harman's winning final round at Hoylake

articles.description: England's hopes of an Ashes comeback are heartbreakingly ended by rain that leaves the fourth Test as a draw and ensures Australia retain the urn.
articles.title: England denied by rain as Australia retain Ashes
